value.name: Labour Proposes Extension of Equal Pay Rights to Black, Asian and Minority Staff
value.description: Keir Starmer initially pledged a race equality act in 2020 and established a task force chaired by Doreen Lawrence. However, the party's lack of specific details raised concerns about its dedication to addressing structural racism. Shadow women and ...

value.name: Starmer ‘to announce scaling back of £28 billion-a-year green pledge’
value.description: An announcement on the party’s flagship green prosperity plan is expected to be made on Thursday. Sir Keir Starmer is due to confirm that the pledge is being scaled back due to the changed economic landscape since it was first unveiled in 2021, according to multiple reports.

value.name: Labour to confirm dropping £28bn a year green investment pledge
value.description: Labour will confirm it is dropping a pledge to spend £28bn a year on green investment if it enters government, following weeks of confusion about the flagship policy. Sir Keir Starmer had originally promised in 2021 to invest £28bn annually until 2030 on green projects if Labour came to power.

value.name: Sir Keir Starmer expected to confirm scaling back of £28bn green pledge
value.description: Sir Keir Starmer is set to confirm on Thursday that Labour is scaling back a £28 billion green investment pledge following weeks of uncertainty. The Labour leader will announce the latest u-turn despite insisting for weeks that he intended to meet the commitment.

value.name: Starmer to announce scaling back of £28bn green investment plan
value.description: Labour leader to say move is down to economic uncertainty caused by Tory government, sources say

value.name: Keir Starmer 'running scared' of anti-Israel mob as he pulls out of event at last minute
value.description: Sir Keir Starmer was accused of "running scared" of anti-Israel protesters after he pulled out of reception in Birmingham for his West Midlands Mayor candidate Richard Parker this evening at the last minute. Decision was communicated to attendees at the ...

value.name: Sir Keir Starmer meets Brianna Ghey's mother in Parliament
value.description: Sir Keir Starmer has met with the mother of murdered teenager Brianna Ghey in Parliament, in the wake of the sentencing of her daughter's killers. Esther Ghey is now campaigning for under-16s to be blocked from accessing social media on smartphones and for stronger parental controls to flag potentially harmful searches to parents.

value.name: PMQs: Keir Starmer calls ‘shame’ after PM makes transgender dig
value.description: At prime minister’s questions today, Labour leader Keir Starmer called “shame” after Rishi Sunak made a dig at his stance of self-identification. In an exchange about the PM’s pledge to cut NHS waiting times,

value.name: Former Scottish Labour minister: 'Keir Starmer can ignore Muslims'
value.description: A FORMER Scottish Labour MP and minister has been accused of Islamophobia by the Muslim Association of Britain

value.name: Letters: 'Keir Starmer specialises in making u-turns'
value.description: The script has been edited and they will not be investing £28 billion every year on green initiatives. In yet another U-turn by Keir Starmer, he and his lieutenants are rewriting their scripts in an effort to cosy up to big business and avoid bad reviews ...

value.name: Keir Starmer’s method has worked so far – now begins his toughest test
value.description: Election campaigns are about making the political weather. And on that crucial test, Labour is struggling, says the Guardian columnist Rafael Behr

value.name: Your three-minute digest
value.description: Sir Keir Starmer will scale back Labour’s £28 billion green spending pledge within weeks despite saying the investment is “desperately needed”. The Labour leader is preparing to announce a new

value.name: Starmer ‘to announce scaling back of £28 billion-a-year green pledge’
value.description: An announcement on the party’s flagship green prosperity plan is expected to be made on Thursday. Sir Keir Starmer is due to confirm that the pledge is being scaled back due to the changed economic landscape since it was first unveiled in 2021, according to multiple reports.

value.name: Brianna Ghey’s father demands apology from Sunak over transgender jibe
value.description: The father of murdered teenager Brianna Ghey has demanded an apology from Rishi Sunak after he made a “dehumanising” transgender joke in the Commons while the victim’s mother visited Parliament.

value.name: Sunak trans jibe: calls for PM to apologise over comments in PMQs
value.description: Rishi Sunak is facing calls to apologise for making a transgender dig at Sir Keir Starmer during PMQs, while Brianna Ghey’s mother was visiting parliament. The Labour leader accused him of shameful behaviour, while Brianna’s father, Peter Spooner, said the comments were “dehumanising” and “degrading”.

value.name: Brianna Ghey’s father demands apology from Rishi Sunak over 'dehumanising' transgender remark
value.description: The father of murdered teenager Brianna Ghey has demanded an apology from Rishi Sunak after he made a “dehumanising” transgender remark in the Commons while the victim’s mother visited Parliament.

value.name: Labour set to ditch target to spend £28bn a year on green investment
value.description: Starmer is poised to use a set piece event to drop the £28bn figure from Labour’s “green prosperity plan”, blaming the worsening public finances under the Conservative government. “There will be an announcement tomorrow,” said a Labour spokesperson.

value.name: Green tech like EVs turns out to be a very uncunning plan… we need the truth to tackle climate change
value.description: SALES of electric cars are falling sharply. Monthly forecourt purchases of these vehicles, which will save the world from burning to bits, fell 17 per cent at the end of last year when compared

value.name: Starmer needs to steady his ship
value.description: The Labour leader may look like he is cruising, but to lead an effective government he will need to get his own house in order

value.name: Sister of transwoman who died awaiting gender-affirming care criticises Sunak's 'devastating' jibe
value.description: The prime minister has come under pressure to apologise for accusing Sir Keir Starmer of having difficulty in 'defining a woman'. | ITV National News

value.name: UK's Sunak criticised over trans jibe
value.description: Opposition politicians demanded UK Conservative Prime Minister Rishi Sunak apologise Wednesday for making a jibe about transgender people in parliament.A spokeswoman for Sunak declined to apologise when pressed by reporters after,

value.name: CBI’s call to Labour over workers’ rights falls on deaf ears
value.description: MPs and unions hit back after business lobby group warns of potential damage to productivity from employment plans

value.name: Sunak strike crackdown could breach Brexit trade deal, EU claims
value.description: The European Union has accused Britain of potentially breaching the Brexit trade deal with Rishi Sunak’s crackdown on strikes. Brussels is considering whether to trigger a formal dispute with No 10 over the introduction of minimum service levels.

value.name: Politics latest: Tory MP tells Sunak to meet Brianna Ghey's family after 'disgraceful' transgender jibe
value.description: The first topic we are discussing tonight on Politics Hub With Sophy Ridge is the criticism levelled at Rishi Sunak for aiming a political jibe about transgender people at Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer - while murder victim Brianna Ghey's mother Esther ...

value.name: Clapham chemical attack suspect's injuries could be 'fatal' if untreated, police say, as they reveal last sighting near London's Vauxhall Bridge
value.description: Police have said the Clapham chemical attack suspect's injuries could be fatal if they remain untreated - as they revealed he was last seen crossing London's Vauxhall Bridge at 11pm and then walking next to the River Thames on the night of the incident.

value.name: Chancellor admits Treasury's costing of Labour's energy efficiency plans may not be correct
value.description: Peston challenged the assumptions that Treasury officials were given by the chancellor’s aides when making the calculations, in particular that a Labour government would not means-test any grants given to homeowners or share the costs with energy companies.
